title: COPF summons Cabraal, P.B. Jayasundera to discuss economic crisis
body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); A group including former Governors of the Central Bank and former Secretaries to the Ministry of Finance were summoned to Parliament today (8) in connection with the investigation launched by the Parliamentary Committee on Finance into the causes of the current economic crisis in the country.
Former Secretary to the President, Dr. P.B. Jayasundara and former Governor of the Central Bank Ajith Nivard Cabraal were also summoned before the committee.

The Chairman of the committee, Anura Priyadarshana Yapa stated that what was notable is that in the situation which arose from 2019 onwards, it became clear that there was a lack of a clear relationship between the policy decisions taken by the Government with regard to tax cuts, and the Ministry of Finance, as well as other institutions.

However, Yapa stated that he will not make a final decision on this issue right now, while pointing out that Finance Committee will discuss the decision to float the dollar, as well as the decisions that were taken to devalue the rupee and the damage it incurred to the country’s economy.
